meanings.definition: To stay in someone else's house and take care of it while they are away.
meanings.sent1: Last summer, I housesat for my neighbor while they went on vacation.
meanings.sent2: She housesat for her friend and watered the plants every day.
meanings.sent3: The cat housesat for the dog, pretending to be the owner of the house.
meanings.sent4: As the sun set, the shadows housesat in the corners of the room.
meanings.sent5: The responsibility of housesitting weighed heavily on his shoulders.

meanings.sent1: Housesat can be a fun way to experience different neighborhoods.
meanings.sent2: The housesat went smoothly, and the homeowners returned to a tidy house.
meanings.sent3: The housesat was so good at their job, they were asked to housesit again.
meanings.sent4: The housesat was like a guardian angel, watching over the empty house.
meanings.sent5: The housesat brought their own pillow to make the couch more comfortable.
